column4: hiya.... anyone know why it would take my cdrom an estimated 50 min to copy 400mb off a cd on to my hd ?   (its an ide LITE-ON LTR-40125W   40x12x48)
LinuxJones yep, i'm using /dev/hdc   and dma is on, so is unmaskirq and 32 bit support
: does it happen with every cd, or just one?
: that will slow it down, but im wondering if it's just a dirty cd / laser, etc.
could be...  it was so slow yesterday, i couldn't even successfully boot up knoppix from it!
odd thing was that when i did an hdparm -t on the knoppix cd it gave i/o errors, but other cd's were fine....
: hmm.. i  wonder if the drive itself is going bad?
yeah thats kinda what i was thinking too... no way a bit of dust gives this odd behaviour
: im tempted to buy one, but im nervous about PPC linux - wondering if ill have a lot of trouble getting random packages to compile.

yeah not too sure about that either... thinking of buying one and sticking with Mac OS for a bit to see what its like... but too afraid they'll come out with the G5 some point this year... not sure if i can wait though... dillemas dillemas... ;-)
: eh, no real interest for me in osx. maybe ill get an older desktop mac and try ubuntu ppc on that first ;)
let us know how you get on ;-)
